seo.title: Nano Banana ‚Äì Text-to-Image & Image Editing on MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Use Google‚Äôs Nano Banana model (via Fal.ai) to generate studio-quality stills or remix existing visuals. Pay per image starting at $0.039.

hero.title: Nano Banana ‚Äì Photoreal Text-to-Image + Image Editing
hero.intro: Nano Banana ships with two Fal endpoints: lightning-fast text-to-image and precise image-to-image editing. It shares the same wallet, logs, and prompt lab as our video engines‚Äîso you can storyboard frames, iterate on references, or prep shot plates directly inside MaxVideoAI.

overview: Nano Banana pairs clean photoreal renders with tight controls (prompt, seed, image uploads, batch count). You can concept thumbnails for Veo/Sora shoots, design marketing key visuals, or upscale storyboard frames before motion work.

bestUseCases.title: Where Nano Banana shines
items: Photoreal concept frames and hero stills
Variant exploration before animating in Veo / Sora
High-quality marketing art without leaving MaxVideoAI
Precise image edits (prop swaps, wardrobe tweaks, room re-lighting)

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: `prompt` (required), `num_images` (1‚Äì8). Edit mode adds `image_urls` for source uploads.

technicalOverview.label: Outputs
technicalOverview.body: High-resolution JPEG/PNG URLs with metadata (description + CDN URL). Each run is logged in Recent Runs & Library.

technicalOverview.label: Pricing
technicalOverview.body: $0.039 / image (text or edit). Wallet + logs identical to video engines.

technicalOverview.label: Seed & batches
technicalOverview.body: Lock the seed to reproduce looks; use `num_images` for multi-shot batches.

promptStructure.title: Prompt mini-guide
promptStructure.quote: ‚ÄúEditorial fashion portrait of a woman in a chrome raincoat under neon signage, 85mm lens, shallow depth of field, cinematic grading.‚Äù
steps: Anchor subject + setting (‚Äúportrait of‚Ä¶ inside a Tokyo jazz bar‚Äù).
Add lens and lighting cues for style (film emulation, aperture, color palette).
Mention mood / action to avoid generic poses.
For edits, describe the transformation (‚Äúreplace the jacket with holographic fabric‚Ä¶‚Äù).
Use `num_images` for variety; reuse the seed when you find a favorite.

tips.title: Tips & tricks
items: üñº Generate keyframes, then feed them into Veo/Sora shot-by-shot.
üé® Treat edit mode as a ‚Äútexture re-roll‚Äù for props, lighting, or wardrobe.
üìö Organize outputs via Library ‚Üí Images to keep campaigns tidy.
‚ö° Use `num_images = 4` with batch naming to compare variations quickly.
üîÅ Pair with the new Image Jobs view to audit spend per concept.

prompts.title: Lifestyle hero shot
prompts.prompt: Golden hour photo of a runner splashing through a Los Angeles backyard pool, high-speed shutter, crisp water droplets, Leica 50mm.

prompts.title: Edit prompt
prompts.prompt: Make the living room brighter, swap the coffee table for a glass slab, add a neon ‚ÄúBANANA‚Äù sign on the back wall.

faqs.a: Set `num_images` between 1 and 8. Each image is logged separately, so you can download / favorite individually.
No‚Äîdescribe the transformation in plain language. For precise regions, upload cropped inputs or run multiple passes.
Every output hits Recent Runs + the new Library ‚Üí Images tab. You can copy the CDN link or download lossless files.

pricingNotes: Expect ~$0.039 per image. A 4-image batch costs ~$0.156, pulled straight from your wallet.
